title: Processes - Arc Length of a Curve

content.question: Which of the following gives the length of the curve <math alttext="y equals, the tangent of x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> from <math alttext="x equals, the negative of the fraction pi over 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></math> to <math alttext="x equals, the fraction pi over 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 4 to the fraction pi over 4, of, the square root of 1 plus the tangent of x, end root, d x" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msubsup><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 4 to the fraction pi over 4, of, the square root of 1 plus tangent squared of x, end root, d x" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msubsup><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 4 to the fraction pi over 4, of, the square root of 1 plus secant squared of x, end root, d x" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msubsup><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 4 to the fraction pi over 4, of, the square root of 1 plus secant to the fourth power of x, end root, d x" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msubsup><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>4</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 4 to the fraction pi over 4, of, the square root of 1 plus secant to the fourth power of x, end root, d x" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msubsup><msqrt><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>4</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></math>

topic.text: 8.13: (BC ONLY) The Arc Length of a Smooth, Planar Curve and Distance Traveled

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
